msItem.quote:
In hoc uolumine continentur hii libri.
Omelie Gregorii papae. super Iezechielem.
Item. Seneca de Beneficiis. libri .vii.
Item eiusdem de clementia.
Item eiusdem de quatuor uirtutibus.
Item.

In hoc uolumine continentur ista
Gregorius super Iezechielem. omelie numero .xii.
Item Seneca de beneficiis. libri .vi.
Item de clemencia.
Item de .iiii.ºʳ uirtutibus principalibus.
Item

msItem.author: Gregory the Great
msItem.title: Homiliae in Ezechielem
msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus dilectissimo fratri mariano episcopo⹎ gregorius. seruus seruorum dei.
msItem.incipit: Omelias que in beato ihezechiele propheta
msItem.explicit: sine carne roborare. iesus christus dominus noster⹎ qui uiuit et regnat cum patre in unitate spiritus sancti deus. per omnia saecula saeculorum amen.

msItem.author: Seneca
msItem.title: De beneficiis
msItem.note: Alternate rubric in the margin (fol. 101r): Annei senece beneficiis uel liberalitate ad ebertium liberalem amicum suum liber primus incipit.
msItem.explicit: Hoc est magni animi perdere et dare.

msItem.author: Seneca
msItem.title: De clementia
msItem.incipit: Scribere de clementia nero caesar institui. ut quodammodo speculi uice fungerer. et te tibi ostenderem peruenturum ad uoluptatem maximam omnium. Facit quidem auidos nimia felicitas.
msItem.explicit: Itaque penam quam exigere debet non donat. sed parcit. consulit. corrigit.

msItem.author: Seneca
msItem.title: De beneficiis
msItem.incipit: Longa retro series ubi est quod consummat et res et animus.
msItem.explicit: Quare pocius te mihi profuisse dicas. quam me tibi?

msItem.author: Martin of Braga
msItem.title: Formula uitae honestae
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber de quatuor uirtutibus principalibus.

msItem.title: Proverbs of the Seven Sleepers, arranged alphabetically
msItem.rubric: Require in fine nomina septem sapientum. Hec sunt eorum prouerbia.
msItem.finalRubric: Hec sunt nomina septem sapientum. Tales milesius. Pitacus mictilenus. Solon ateniensis. Cilon Lacedemonius. Periandrus. chorintius. Cleobolus lidius. Bias pierenus;

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De sancta uirginitate
msItem.incipit: Pergite sancti dei pueri ac puelle. mares ac femine. celibes et innupte. pergite perseuerantur in finem.
msItem.explicit: Vos ergo uos ite post eum uir
msItem.note: Breaks off incomplete; possibly the erased item in the opening list of contents.
Note on the vices and virtues of Mediterranean and northern European peoples
msItem.incipit: Inuidia iudeorum. Fallacia grecorum. Vanitas africorum. Crudelitas hunorum. Stulticia saxonum.
msItem.explicit: Duricia pictauorum. Vinolentia hispanorum. Egiptorum insolentia.
msItem.finalRubric: Viuite iuste uiuite continentur quia uix audet quisquam in illos excedere in quibus culpas non potest inuenire.

supportDesc.support: parchment; some pages spattered with wax (e.g. fols. 71r–72r)
supportDesc.extent: iii (17th-century paper endleaves, modern foliation i–iii) + 129 (foliated iv–vi, 1–126) + ii (17th-century paper endleaves, foliated 127–128) leaves 315 205

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in drypoint; 2 columns of 33 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Protogothic script; at least three hands.

decoDesc.decoNote: Opening initial in red (fol. 1r) with simple decoration; both this and the opening rubric highlighted with a pale yellow wash.
Coloured initials in red and blue.
Most tituli in red; some written with letters alternating between red and blue.

physDesc.additions: Additional accentuation and modifications to punctuation on many pages, often in darker ink, to make the text easier to read aloud. Probably contemporary with the original.

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Abp. Laud.

history.acquisition: Part of his first donation to the Bodleian, 1635.

recordHist.source: Description by Andrew Dunning, September 2020; previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 230 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 52

revisionDesc.change: James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
